column1: Where is the secretory compound situated in the ENDOCRINE cells?
column3: In ducts leading to an epithelial surface
column4: In the extracellular matrix between cells
column6: Inside the nucleus as chromatin granules
column8:
Correct: A. Secretory granules/vesicles within the cytoplasm
Endocrine cells store hormones in cytoplasmic secretory granules and release them by exocytosis into nearby capillaries (no ducts).

column1: The demilunes of Giannuzzi consists of:
column2: Crescent-shaped serous cell caps on mucous acini
column4: Elastic fibers in the gland capsule
column5: Rows of myoepithelial cells around ducts only
column8:
Correct: A. Crescent-shaped serous cell caps on mucous acini
Giannuzzi demilunes are serous cells forming a crescent over mucous acini in mixed salivary glands.

column1: The intraepithelial glands are:
column8:
Correct: B. Exocrine glands
Intraepithelial glands are epithelial secretory cells located within an epithelium (e.g., goblet cells), releasing products to a surface → exocrine.

column1: Match the different types of secretion from the glands on the left with their corresponding answer:
column2:
Merocrine ⇒ exocytosis
Apocrine ⇒ apical cytoplasm shed
Holocrine ⇒ whole cell disintegrates
column3:
Merocrine ⇒ whole cell disintegrates
Apocrine ⇒ exocytosis
Holocrine ⇒ apical cytoplasm shed
column4:
Merocrine ⇒ apical cytoplasm shed
Apocrine ⇒ whole cell disintegrates
Holocrine ⇒ exocytosis
column5:
Merocrine ⇒ secretion into blood
Apocrine ⇒ secretion into lymph
Holocrine ⇒ secretion into cartilage
column8:
Correct: A
  • Merocrine: exocytosis (most glands)
  • Apocrine: apical cytoplasm pinches off
  • Holocrine: entire cell becomes secretion (sebaceous)

column1: Finish the sentences with the corresponding statement from the dropdown list:
column2: The transitional epithelium is found only in ⇒ urinary system
column3: The transitional epithelium is found only in ⇒ respiratory system
column4: The transitional epithelium is found only in ⇒ gastrointestinal tract
column5: The transitional epithelium is found only in ⇒ endocrine glands
column6: The transitional epithelium is found only in ⇒ serous membranes
column8:
Correct: A
Transitional epithelium (urothelium) lines the urinary tract and is specialized for distension.

column1: The stratified cuboidal epithelium is found in:
column4: The bigger ducts of the exocrine glands
column8:
Correct: C. The bigger ducts of the exocrine glands
Stratified cuboidal epithelium typically lines large ducts (e.g., sweat, salivary, mammary gland ducts).

column1: Which of the following cells are with haploid chromosome set?
column8:
Correct: D. Spermatozoids
Haploid (n) cells include spermatids and spermatozoa. Primary spermatocytes and spermatogonia are diploid.

column1: The attaching and adhesive junctions are known as:
column8:
Correct: C. Cell junctions
Attaching/adhesive junctions are a major category of cell junctions (anchoring junctions, e.g., adherens junctions, desmosomes, hemidesmosomes).

column1: Match the correct answer:
column8:
Correct: C. Down syndrome ⇒ Trisomy 21
Down syndrome is most commonly caused by trisomy 21 due to meiotic nondisjunction.

column1: Which of the following structures are NOT cell inclusions?
column8:
Correct: E. Centrioles
Cell inclusions are non-living cytoplasmic accumulations (lipid, glycogen, pigments). Centrioles are structural components of the centrosome, not inclusions.

column1: Which is an example of tight junctions?
column8:
Correct: B. Zonula occludens
Tight junctions (zonula occludens) seal the intercellular space and maintain epithelial polarity.

column1: Which of the following pigments belongs to the group of iron pigments?
column8:
Correct: C. Hemoglobin
Iron-containing pigments include hemoglobin (and storage forms like hemosiderin). Non-iron pigments: melanin, lipofuscin, bilirubin.

column1: Melanin is a polymer of oxidation products of:
column8:
Correct: B. Tyrosine
Melanin synthesis starts from tyrosine via tyrosinase (DOPA pathway) in melanosomes.

column1: A centrosome is made of:
column8:
Correct: A. A pair of centrioles
The centrosome is the main microtubule-organizing center, containing two centrioles (mother + daughter) plus pericentriolar material.

column1: All listed are examples of intermediate filaments EXCEPT
column8:
Correct: E. Tubulin
Intermediate filaments: keratin, vimentin, desmin, neurofilaments, GFAP. Tubulin builds microtubules, not intermediate filaments.

column1: Match the cells listed on the left with their appropriate characteristics:
column8:
Correct: A. Plasma cell ⇒ antibody production
Plasma cells are dedicated to immunoglobulin synthesis and secretion (abundant RER, eccentric nucleus).

column1: Tissue macrophages are called:
column8:
Correct: B. Histiocytes
Resident macrophages in connective tissue are called histiocytes. Fibroblasts synthesize extracellular matrix.

column1: The compound glands have:
column8:
Correct: B. Branched system of main "exit" ducts
Compound glands have a branched duct system (simple glands have unbranched ducts).

column1: Which of the enumerated cells are NOT bone cells:
column8:
Correct: B. Chondrocytes, fibroblasts, adipocytes
Bone cells: osteoprogenitors, osteoblasts, osteocytes, osteoclasts. Chondrocytes (cartilage), fibroblasts (CT), adipocytes (fat) are not bone cells.

column1: Which type of dentin is located closest to the dental pulp?
column8:
Correct: D. Circumpulpal dentin
Circumpulpal dentin forms the bulk of dentin and lies adjacent to the pulp chamber, produced by odontoblasts.
